basic.floral_language:
Digitalis mertonensis
Floriography: beautiful, vivid, lovely
Digitalis mertonensis is an herb plant with graceful shape and dark green oval leaves, huge flowers in bell-shape, slightly drooping and open from bottom to top along the stem, like sounding horns, vivid and lovely. Suitable for flower beds or garden landscaping.
Digitalis mertonensis likes adequate sunlight, slightly resistant to half shade, shade properly in summer to avoid strong sunlight. Flower in May-June for 2-3 weeks viewing.
basic.blooming: Flowering period May-June, viewing period 2-3 weeks

maintenance.soil: Peat or soil with specific nutrients
maintenance.sunlight: Like adequate light, resistant to half shade, avoid strong direct light in summer
maintenance.watering: Water thoroughly after soil surface dries
maintenance.fertilization: Dilute fertilizers following instructions, apply once monthly in spring
maintenance.pruning: Remove withered flowers, peduncle, diseased and dead leaves timely
